themes: Critique of current arts funding premises
Emphasis on public benefit and healthy arts ecosystem
Debate over support for emerging artists vs. professional sector
Concerns about gatekeeping in the arts
Recognition of ACME's creation as positive progress
key_phrases: faulty premises that have dominated the discussion about arts funding
where is the focus on public benefit?
a healthy professional arts sector is actually the most effective way to provide opportunities for emerging artists
move away from the idea that it is a public responsibility to foster emerging artists and reach every individual who thinks they are a creative
the very creation of ACME is a long needed good start
barriers_identified: Dominance of faulty premises in arts funding discussions
Overemphasis on supporting every emerging artist
solutions_proposed: Refocus on public benefit in arts funding
Support a wide variety of cultural work and support systems
Strengthen the professional arts sector to benefit both emerging artists and the general public
